column9: What do you like best about Sage Intacct?
column10: What do you dislike about Sage Intacct?
column11: What problems is Sage Intacct solving and how is that benefiting you?

column2: Senior data analyst; Information Technology and Services
column8: "Top-tier tool for achieving financial precision in budgeting and planning"
column9: Sage Intacct's real-time access to financial data is one of its most noteworthy features. Because we can quickly obtain current financial information, this has been essential when making important decisions. The software offers a great platform for developing financial controls and guaranteeing adherence to accounting rules.Customer service from Sage Intacct has been prompt in responding and providing valuable answers. Our team has benefited greatly from their expertise and desire to help. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: While most of the complex capabilities of the software are easy to use, mastering them has taken some effort.For busy professionals who must access financial data on the go, expanding the features of the mobile app would be advantageous.It might be advantageous to offer more adaptable price structures or packages that are designed for various business sizes. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: Having real-time access to financial data has given us the ability to act quickly on data-driven decisions, improving financial results. Our finance operations have changed substantially as a result of Sage Intacct. Our financial processes' manual and time-consuming nature is one of the key issues it has resolved. We have significantly decreased the time spent on data input and reconciliations because of Sage Intacct's automation capabilities, allowing us to concentrate on more critical financial responsibilities. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column8: "Intacct - The very best mid-market accounting system on the market truly designed by accountants"
column9: Intacct has many amazing features, but what I like most about Intacct, is that it is obvious that accountants were very involved in its creation as it handles real life debit and credit transactions the way they should be handled, and you never have to worry about intercompany being out of balance. It uses what Intacct calls demensional accounting, and with these dimensions properly thought out and set up, you can slice and dice the information anyway that you can think. If you are especially in a service industry, it is the very best. I have over 5,000 hours invested in this product working for 2 different organizations and was an administrator of this product for 3 years. Love it. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: They have a ways to go to be competitive in the warehouse distribution/inventory organizations. I feel they have improved this module and functionality over the years, but still need more improvements to truly compete with some of the other mid-market solutions that have been servicing that industry for a while. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: In my current position there are many different locations and entities in the organization, and the main benefit is the ease of keeping intercompany reconciled very easily across a very large organization with many different people involved in the process. Wthout Intacct, Intercompany reconciliation would be very difficult to keep balanced. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column9: Everything is very Simple and cut and dry. I like that sage keeps our books very clean and allows processing to flow smoothly. Convenient reports for overview and The Dashboard Provides an overview of revenue and cash flow thats easy to look at for quick answers. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: The only thing i would say is least helpful about Sage Intacct is that we receive a lot of payments that sometimes do not have the correct reference numbers on it. We then have to do research to figure out where that payment should go so it can be invoiced, if we cannot find the customer the payment cannot be posted as a negative balance/ over payment and that causes some delays in receiving payments. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: We used to scramble at month end to get a good forecast of what our local revenue would be, but with Sage Intacct we can see an overview on the dashboard live for better goal performance and review. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column8: "Sage Intacct - A Powerful Cloud-Based Accounting Software for Growing Businesses"
column9:
Contract module has good functionality for subscription billing because we can send timely billing to all our customers.
This feature is beneficial for businesses with multiple locations or subsidiaries, as it allows them to manage financials for each entity separately while consolidating data for a comprehensive view.
Sage Intacct adheres to industry standards and security best practices to keep financial data safe and compliant with regulations.
The software is designed to be user-friendly, making it easier for accountants and finance professionals to navigate and work efficiently. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10:
Cost: it can be relatively expensive compared to some other accounting software options, especially for smaller businesses with limited budgets.
Support and customer service: the responsiveness and effectiveness of Sage Intacct's customer support, there are delays in getting assistance or issues adequately addressed.
Customization limitations: customization options may require more advanced technical expertise or coding knowledge. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11:
Streamlining Accounting Processes: Sage Intacct addresses the challenge of manual and time-consuming accounting processes. By automating tasks such as data entry, transaction processing, and reconciliation, the software saves significant time and reduces the risk of human errors.
Enhancing Financial Visibility: Many businesses struggle with gaining real-time insights into their financial performance. Sage Intacct provides customizable dashboards and reports, allowing users to access up-to-date financial data, analyze trends, and make informed decisions promptly.
Scalability for Growth: As businesses expand, their accounting needs become more complex. Sage Intacct is designed to accommodate growth, providing scalability that enables companies to manage increased transaction volumes, multiple entities, and evolving financial requirements.
Ensuring Compliance and Security: Compliance with financial regulations is crucial for businesses of all sizes. Sage Intacct follows industry standards and employs robust security measures to protect financial data, mitigating the risks associated with non-compliance and data breaches.
Facilitating Collaboration: With cloud-based accessibility, Sage Intacct facilitates collaboration among team members, regardless of their location. This aspect is particularly beneficial for businesses with remote or distributed teams.
Integrating Business Applications: Sage Intacct's integration capabilities allow it to connect with other essential business applications like CRM, payroll, or inventory management systems. This seamless integration ensures that data flows smoothly across various platforms, minimizing data silos and improving overall operational efficiency.
Improving Financial Decision-making: By providing accurate and timely financial information, Sage Intacct empowers businesses to make well-informed decisions, strategize effectively, and identify areas for cost optimization and revenue growth.
Reducing IT Infrastructure Overheads: As a cloud-based solution, Sage Intacct eliminates the need for businesses to maintain and manage their own IT infrastructure. This results in cost savings, as cloud-based software typically requires fewer hardware investments and less maintenance. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column9: The reports and website feel modifiable and adjustable to individualize for the user and to the format and data to meet your requirements. You can change menu's, favorites, order of data, etc. And the reports can organized and created in the website interface without having to open a code-based platform to program. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: Some of the privileges are frustrating to work through. Gaining access to some data sets can be difficult. Meanwhile, restricting views from others is also inefficient. I don't want to see other users' personalized reports, and I don't want them to see mine. But when we inquired about this with Sage, they said they didn't have a current system to accommodate this. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: The software is under continual development. Sage is constantly rolling out progressed versions and software. If we have a personal request of feature we would like, Sage works directly with us to add or implement. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column9: I love how easy it is to pick up from square one. Having been using QuickBooks before the change seemed daunting, but it was straightforward and easy to learn in under 3 months. The site is clean and easy to read. They are constantly rolling out updates to make the user experience more enjoyable. I am quite pleased with how easy the check deposits and AP invoices are. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: Least favorite thing is that there is no dark mode. For my disabilities, I function much better with a dark or dimmer system, and Intacct (as far as i am aware) is only sheet white, which gets draining on the eyes after 3-9 hours of use. I also do not see a text-to-speech option here for further accessibility. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: It has helped our company have a far clearer and more organized spot for all the AP and AR accounting. It has given us a way to better assure the correct payment is going to the correct place. I enjoy how easy it is to pick up and learn each new feature as well! Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column9: It was very easy to learn and simplified many of our reconciliation and AP/AR processes. The importing function was great for large entries. Reports are clean and easy to analyze periodic results. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: We had difficulties with consistent bank transaction connections. Also, I wish you could copy/paste from an Excel table into a journal entry. If an AP transaction was accidentally entered for a future date, we could not edit it. Also, in the bank reconciliation process, if you have two or more GL entries that match against two or more bank transactions, you can't reconcile them against eachother. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: Sage Intacct simplified the AP approval process and added controls to ensure accurate billing. Also, we were able to acquire additional companies with ease and were able to maintain the same finance head count. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column9: We use this system for invoice entry and managing the expenses across various teams. Since we have multiple programs, we needed a software that could be used across the agency. Sage has been easy to learn, including invoice entry, approval processes and has been user friendly for our staff. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: My only dislike at this time is that it's not always easy for managers and approvers to search for specific data, however with some fine tuning we figure it out. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: Sage is allowing for all the managers who work in different areas of our business to use a system that allows us all to communicate appropriately. This allows for folks who work in different areas to work on the same system. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column8: "Easy to learn-not the best for complicated entity structures"
column9: Very easy to learn for new users-seems intuitive. Lots of good reports. I like the ability to create custom views and export to Microsoft Excel. Good audit trail. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: Doesn't work as well for complicated entity structures. We are stuck with some less helpful entity structures that we couldn't change in the system. Apparently, it is not possible to change these past the initial setup. We also were not able to set up the consolidation module due to the initial setup. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: Complicated accounting for multiple locations and projects. Good audit trail to see who is responsible for specific entries. Good report-pulling capabilities. The downside is that pulling the report for all entities' trial balance YTD takes a really long time and we have not been able to implement the consolidation module that is available through Intacct due to the initial setup several years ago. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column9: We are a multi- entity organization. Real time insights across multi- entities are a “must”. Sage Premier provides an easy Bank reconciliation process. Reporting and Dashboards have awesome features. Also, we have streamlined payment processing. And another amazing module is the Integrated Fixed Assets. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: There are few things regarding the Bank reconciliation that makes the transactions import impossible directly from our bank account. Also, few things on the Fixed Asset module. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: We recently transitioned to AssetEdge (fixed assets). Implementation was somehow a smooth process. There are few things that need some improvements but overall, its an easy process. Reporting is great. It provides us with more clarity and flexibility when doing our analyses. The dashboard very friendly for other departments (not accounting), across the organization. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column9: One of the best features of SAGE Intacct is the fact that you can connect and integrate third-party vendors via API to automate journal entries, transactions, and data from outside sources. This has enabled us to completely stop manual entries and has allowed us to us saved hours to focus on financial decision making. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: AR and AP aging is limited to certain filters and does not allow for customizing by other dimensions. A work-around is to go through custom reporting but dimensions should be included as an option. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: The AP automation function has allowed us to quickly review, approve and make prompt payments to vendors. Prior to AP automation, all payables were entered manually, which was time consuming given the volume. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column8: "Sage Intacct enhances the way you use Salesforce."
column9: The thing I like best about Sage Intacct is the integration with Salesforce. It's straightforward to set up and configure. It allows you to tailor the integration of your data to your company's needs. You also have a team of experts at Sage ready to help if needed. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: The only thing I dislike or would improve in Sage Intacct would be the UX for admins. The navigation is a little tricky and convoluted. This may be a bit biased, but I would look to Salesforce for inspiration with how their setup is configured with a quick fin search and drop-down easily accessible within the Setup console. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: Sage is helping to solve our issues with accounting data management and analytics. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column9: Ease of understanding. I was able to produce reports and find detail day 1 of using Sage. Ability to further customize reports and dial in on desired info is straightforward. We don't spend much time "training" new employees to use Sage. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: Fixed Asset Module leaves a little to be desired, it seems a bit unpolished. It is helpful and detailed, but sometimes we are surprised by how it functions. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: Reporting. We can create detailed reports, P and L's with margins included. Journal Entries are a breeze. Recurring entries are easy to create, if multiple entries are needed we can duplicate easily and update the date. So while we are always trying to cut down on the amount of Journal entries needed at month end, we have no problem or time tax for creating many. The ease of use if exceptional. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column9: You're able to do everything imaginable when it comes to accounting in Sage Intacct. I've used other accounting services and Intacct tops them all. It's easy to use and makes everything easier. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: I cannot think of anything that I dislike about Intacct. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: Sage Intacct has helped automate a lot of accounting processes that otherwise would have taken a lot of time and effort to create from the ground up. The best part is that it syncs with everything we use automatically so that we don't have to pull data from all of our multiple sources. As someone who is very entry level knowledge of accounting, Intacct has made things easy to understand. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column8: "Sage Intacct is a good accounting tool but is working towards more with Sage Intacct Construction."
column9: Sage Intacct offers a lot of robust reporting from a General Ledger perspective. Their financial and custom reports are easy to build and give customization as needed. The software is cloud based so can be accessed anywhere which is useful when travelling or working from home. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: I work for a complex company that has acquired numerous other companies over the years. We have just converted over to Sage Intacct Construction but are working through a lot of bug issues and kinks to get the system to work for us. A lot of the kinks are industry standard for us, so we did not expect to run into these issues. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: They are working towards building out Sage Intacct Construction, which we have long needed. We are still working through bug issues and kinks, but we are in a better place now than we were a few years ago. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column8: "A wonderful experience of accounting and book keeping"
column9:
We have come across some wonderful features about Sage Intacct -
- Data gets updated without much manual interference and most of the time data will be accurate
- We can generate some reports which help us analyse the data and come to necessary conclusion Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10:
There are very minute things we think can be improved -
- Once the invoice status turns to "Paid" - we cant make any changes. In case the payment/credit memo is applied incorrectly, we cant edit the same. All we have to do is VOID the payment, which will again generate multiple entries.
- If we can make it more user friendly, it would be great. Many times, we would have a report which is very useful, but we would not know by its name. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11:
- Data gets updated without much manual interference and most of the time data will be accurate
- We can generate some reports which help us analyse the data and come to necessary conclusion Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column9: Sage Intacct has to be one of the best ERP systems I have come across. It gives small/Medium enterprise the flexibility and customizability of a larger ERP system like SAP, without the cost and complexity. Definetley the future of ERP systems. Would highly recommend. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: No real dislikes about Sage Intacct. A desktop version of the system down the line may be useful, leveraging off the internal hardware processing power as opposed to being web based which can sometimes be slow. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: Project management and resource management is a massively useful function. The divisional setup we have implemented has allowed traditionally non finance staff (HoD's) to use the system with relative ease and gives them a real time view of project, billing and AR info. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column9: Sage Intacct is a pretty intuitive system. I started a new position in a company that uses Sage. I had no prior experience with the system, but found it pretty easy to pick up. The learning help provided by Sage was great as well, and has helped make the transition to a new role that much smoother. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: So far I find some of the reporting tools to be a little inefficient. Also, having to have exact information (such as customer or invoice numbers) to complete a search can be a challenge. It would be nice to be able to type in partial info and get results. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: It helps having all of our accounting functions in this one space. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column8: "It is pretty easy to get around the system but there's nothing that really sticks out"
column9: User friendly and easy to read the information presented to you. The system is dependable and quick to load. There are some quirks to the system but once you have a good understanding of how it works, it is easy to get where you need. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: Maybe it is just the way our company has the system set up but it can be confusing finding the right area that I need to be. I also wish I could select multiple clients when printing invoices or statements. We have multiple locations set up for some clients but their customer IDs aren't consecutive so I have to do the search multiple times. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: We use intacct for invoicing, which includes attaching documents to invoices. I really like being able to send those documents along with the invoices as emails directly to clients. It saves time and is very simple. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column9:
I like the fact that Sage is so easy to navigate.
In Sage, there's this box where you can upload file such as proof of your financial request.
Sage keeps everything organized so that even later on we can go back to review our document. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: The description box and justification for the payment box are repetitive since in the attachment box where you attach financial proof, they ask for a description already, so just minimize to 1 box to save time. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: Sage keeps everything organized and makes it easy to go back and review financial files. I like that Sage has prefilled items so that its just a click away from getting to the right financial folders. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column8: "There are some great features and some so-so features"
column9: The layout of the software is pretty simple to navigate. I like how you can customize your profile with your chosen color. Regarding the bill section, I like how you can put a bill on hold so you know if you should pay it or not. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: As powerful as the reporting section is, I find it tricky to figure out which report to pull to get my desired answers. And sometimes, when I want specific information in my report to make it easier to follow, the option to include that particular information is not an option. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: Where Sage helped with what I used it for what with the bills. If I received an invoice from a vendor and then checked the purchase order that went along with it and we did not receive those goods yet, I would just put the bill on hold and I could come back to it at a later time to check if we received those goods yet. It helped us with not paying for things that were not received yet. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column8: "If you need a No-frills system with state of the art capabilities, consider Sage Intacct"
column9: The ability to work from anywhere in the world as long as you have internet is definitely one of the best qualities of Intacct. The Automation capabilties certainly speak for themself. Sage Intacct is best for small business trying to grow and want their accounting system to have their back. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10:
Some features are clunky and time consuming to learn. The support team is always great to work with but they need to invest more to ensure that the response time is lowered.
Online training platform is available but there should also be live tutorials and popups on the fuctions we use so that we can learn the system on the go. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: Intacct is solving accounting issues for us. However, I feel that we still need to explore the full capabilities of the product which will add a lot of value to our business as a whole. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column8: "Easy to use, strong modules.  User friendly procedures, have experienced no downtime."
column9: The system assisted our shift to a paperless environment through shared access, electronic filing, and electronic approvals of payables. Dashboards and customized reporting are beneficial to agency leaders. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: The only thing, and it is small, is the general ledger reporting system, which summarizes transactions at the batch level. There is no easy visibility of the vendors and invoices that make up expenditures. It can be done in other ways, and drill-down capabilities work well, but if we could have vendor detail on general ledger reports of expense accounts, that would be helpful. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: Sage Intacct has increased our capacity for reporting and sharing data internally and externally with our board, finance committee, and funders. In addition, the technology allowed our Organization to adjust to hybrid and remote schedules without losing any functionality. Sage Intacct provides for external users in read-only mode, which assists our audit process. Electronic copies of invoices, bills, receipts, and invoices with support assist in our grant billing process. Our old system did not handle consolidations well and it wasn't easy to obtain reports and data that could be shared. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column8: "An incredible, exceptional and powerful financial management solution"
column9: I like Sage Intacct for its comprehensive reporting capabilities. Its intuitive design makes it easy to access key data within the programme quickly and efficiently, even without prior training or experience. The visually appealing interface is an added bonus, allowing users to focus on the more meaningful aspects of their work rather than trying to interpret information from a cumbersome report. Thanks to this intelligent platform management system, our department managers now have direct visual insight into relevant figures and are always up to date with any changes in activity. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: I find the lack of aesthetics and design in Sage Intacct disappointing. The pages are plain, almost sterile looking; not conducive to increased productivity or creativity. In addition, some modules, such as payment processing, can take an inordinate amount of time to load, which is a major hindrance when trying to get work done quickly. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: Sage Intacct saves me time by eliminating the need to manually enter invoices into my system. The ability to upload supplier IDs via file also makes it easier and faster for us, which has significantly improved our overall efficiency. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column8: "Most User Friendly Accounting Software I've Used"
column9: Sage is extremly user friendly. Even for first time accounting users. It's by far the best system I have used. Customer service is fast whenever there is an issue which is very rare. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: The only thing that I dislike is that it automatically signs you out after so many active hours. It always falls at 2:00 PM during the work day and you have to sign back in. Small issue though. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: It's extremely user friendly so even when I train someone who has never worked in accounting, they're able to catch on very fast. It also has so many useful reports that we use daily. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column8: "A very convenient book keeping software for accountants"
column9: It is very user-friendly, easy to understand, and since it is a cloud-based accounting software, it can be accessed from anywhere in the world. It also duplicates transactions which makes invoicing very convenient to use. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: It does not have any feature to notify multiple vendors of payments made to them- this has to be done manually and gets very time-consuming when there are many vendors. It is also challenging to record discounts received from customers. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: It is one stop software for all our accounting needs - we can use it for accounts receivables, payables, credit card and bank reconciliations, creating orders and. Sage also ties up with our organization's AP automation software - Yooz. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column8: "Great flexibility, but customization takes too long."
column9: I like the flexibility of this platform as opposed to other, more rigid platforms I've worked with. In the past with other platforms, I couldn't just remove a bad entry. I would have to create reversals. Not having unnecessary reversals is helpful when it comes to the reconciliation processes. Because of this flexibility and the fact that there are rarely any reconciliation issues between the sub ledger and the general ledger, I'd highly recommend this software pack. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: What I dislike most about the software is the lack of customization of the platform. It took me three months to get a working invoice template from them. I would also like to add that the color schemes and company logo cannot show a semi-customizable platform. Creating a color coding system for divisions in the software would be most useful. They are getting along the way with some automated tasks, but there is still a long way to go to complete push-button automation. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: Managing multiple companies and bank accounts that do not have API's is most laborious. I would much rather have an AI discern items, and then the user reviews the AI's work for accuracy, including reading and reconciling a bank statement. Managing a workup for pre-paids processing by working out the expense period where possible without input from the user. Managing a detailed and easily reportable fixed assets schedule and entry detail, making disposition seemless. Essentially I would like the automation that would allow a Fortune 500 to be run by a single individual and an interconnected network of users that could invoice and pay across the platform. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column8: "Sage Intacct does everything it needs to for the typical employee."
column9:
The overall simplicity, ease of use, and accessibility options are what I like best about Sage Intacct.
What could be improved is to have a shortcuts button on the homepage to go directly to pages you visit often. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: Overall I like Sage Intacct and don't have many criticism on the finance/billing software itself but a nice quality of life change would be to add a "frequently visited page" Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: Sage Intacct is solving our organization's use of billing hours down to the granularity of the hour. It allows to monitor how we charge clients, parent company, lock in PTO, etc. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column8: "Efficient financial management tool with a user friendly interface"
column9:
I like the toools intuitive user interface which make it extreemly easy to navigate and use the advanced features.
The tool provides us with highly customizable reports making it possible for us to leverage the insighful information from our financial data
The customer support of Sage Intacct is also one of the best and they are highly responsive and ready to help incase of any issue Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: Sage Intacct works great and the only on i can point out is the learning curve which might be abit high to new users despite the tool having an easy to use interface Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: Sage Intacct is one of a kind tool that has been the backbone of our accounting revenue and espense management.The tool is crucial for our project tracking and accounting , allowing us to monitor project expenses, revenue, and profitability Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column8: "The best accounting ERP system for your business"
column9: I particularly like the ability to drill down into real-time financial analysis and budgeting. Sage Intacct gives you unparalleled insight so you can make proactive decisions faster than ever before. You can view revenues and expenses by month or quarter; analyse variances between projected and actual performance with graphical representations for easy comparisons; create custom dashboards of key indicators such as accounts receivable versus sales orders, different types of activity related numbers that are continuously monitored along with many other available metrics within the system all provide amazing capabilities that bring a business closer to being 'fully informed' at every decision point. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: I find it frustrating that the project and task columns in Sage Intacct are so limited. With no means of expanding them, all names are truncated at a certain length and become difficult to differentiate when they start with similar titles. The same problem exists with the Tasks column, making it difficult for me to interpret the data efficiently. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: I use Sage Intacct to facilitate financial analysis, budgeting, and reporting. I've found the reconciliation module to be particularly helpful; it has enabled me to streamline my financial operations in a shorter period of time. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column8: "Wonderful and flexible cloud based accounting solution"
column9: Sage's strength is its ease of use. Modules and applications are laid out logically, and the ability to customize workflows or create new workflows and reports based on company needs is fantastic. Couple that with the best online support documentation that I have seen, and you could competently build or rebuild an instance of Sage with just the written online documentation Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: What can be frustrating about Sage is the complexity of custom reports. While the options for custom report creation are almost endless, the dizzying amount of options also makes custom reports tedious and challenging to generate. Creating an additional layer in custom reports with streamlined options for quick report creation while leaving the detailed option that currently exists would be an improvement to Sage. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: For us, Sage is a flexible cloud-based solution. Sage provides many options for how data can be labeled and stored. These options give the user multiple ways to pull reports and data from different angles to help make the best analysis possible. Our company is spread out and operates many small locations so the cloud-based system allows access to the system anywhere there is interet. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column8: "a bit of a struggle getting used to after so long with another program but is easy to navagate!"

column10: The back-end mapping needed can get convoluted and like all software, you don't know what you don't know until you run into an issue. One of the areas that I believe need to be built out better is the audit trail. It doesn't seem to tag people's edits on certain fields, so tracking who did what change can be difficult. Another area isthe template upload error emails. If there is an error in the CSV upload, the email notification on the reason why can be unhelpful in knowing what to correct in the next try. column10:
1. Export to excel does not include formulas (I waste so many hours recreating formulas it's infuriating)
2. Implementation required a third party that messed up our configuration, and there was no help to fix the configuration error, which cost additional money for another third party to correct.
3. Quickbooks credit card processing was streamlined; Intacct does not have a native cc processor, and one has to build one for Stripe with a third party.
4. Product releases are confusing and slow. Announcement of Artificial Intelligence for Billing in 2021, but did not follow through with release until 2023, with no straightforward implementation instructions.
5. Dashboards are not very dynamic and visually unappealing.
6. Basic dashboard are weak compared to QuickBooks.
7. Report writing is complex and not user-friendly. Quickbooks out of the box reports are super easy in comparison. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column8: "One of the best accounting software packages I have used"

column10: The reporting could be better. I would have liked more pre-set options for standard reports and more options when choosing fields in the report center. I would like to be able to "favorite" certain pages or views beyond what is currently offered. I also really dislike the debit and credit memo module. I think the application of the DM and CM's are backward and don't allow for much functionality and applicability as other Sage competitors. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: I really like the AP auotmation and follow-through of those processes. It reduces time spent reviewing and tracking PR's and PO's. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column9: The program offers a lot of great features. This was my first time using Sage and I found that after some training, it is fairly user friendly. The reports are helpful too. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: We use it for construction and development and some of the features don't seem to be really designed for that. For instance we can't seem to get an appropriate AIA. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: Sage has helped us processing payments to our vendors and tracking our budget vs actuals. We have also found the reports to helpful when managing our budgets for our projects. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column8: "An intuitive, modern, cloud-based system, overall positive experience"
column9: Sage Intacct has lots of good features. It is largely intuitive and easy to navigate. The reporting functionality is powerful and the workflows such as accounts payable are good. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: Some more basic functionality seems to be lacking / less efficient or under developments, such as transacting accross multiple currencies within the same entities Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: Improved automation and audit trail around accounts payable which is a big improvement over our old Excel system. Cloud based and therefore more easily accessible and easier to upgrade. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column8: "Sage Intact makes it faster to complete work"
column9: I like the ability to import. It allows me to complete my invoices in a faster manner. I also love that you can email invoices, rather than mail them allowing for people to receive them in a faster manner. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: I dislike how you have to go to many different screens to see what someone owes, and what someone has paid. That takes a lot longer to find information. There should be one place that shows all of the account activity. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: Sage intact allows us to enter information in a faster manner than we did with our other software. It also allows us to email clients directly from the program rather than having to print and scan invoices for email delivery. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column9: One of the things I love about this software is its user-friendly interface. It's easy to navigate, and the dashboard comes in super handy. I can quickly access my income statement, balance sheet, and other reports that help me stay on top of my finances. The AP and AR modules are game changing! Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: There are also capabilities for a lot of features so you can get lost sometimes if you add them all, but this could also be a positive for a more complex organization. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: Sage Intacct solves financial management problems such as manual data entry, lack of real-time visibility, and difficulty in consolidating information. It provides automation, real-time insights, and easy-to-use tools for financial management, saving time and costs, improving accuracy, and helping businesses to grow and succeed. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column8: "I've used Intacct for 6 years and implemented it at 2 companies"
column9:
Intacct provided a valuable solution to nonprofit accounting compared to the older financial systems that were being used. The cloud based system allowed my teams to work effectively at home without worry of interruption regardless of where you are. We were fortunate enough to have already implemented Intacct before the pandemic. Even now that the pandemic has became an afterthought, Intacct still contributes greatly to our hybrid work model.
Intacct's ability to incorporate other softwares for direct feed is also an amazing function. I have linked Intacct to various tools such as Expensify, Adaptive Insights, Sage Intacct Planning (Budget), Salesforce, Ariett, etc. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: Intacct has a great foundation, but to tailor to your company's needs, you may need a lot of additional tools which could add up in costs. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: In my first experience with Intacct, my company benefited from using Intacct's purchasing system in conjunction with Ariett. We were able to create purchase orders which linked to Intacct and keep track of POs on a large scale. In my current job, we do not have an extensive purchasing need so we were able to get by with Intacct's core functionality. We use Intacct's purchasing to allow managers to submit and approve invoices rather than have AP take the load of entering bills. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column8: "Strong Finance Software but Inflexible and not a lot of room for growth"
column9: Sage has a strong financial focus and would work very well in a consulting services or Time and Materials situation. It struggles with project management and project finance and has limited functionality in that area. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10:
The report writing and dashboard functionality is very outdated and made worse by inflexible data structures. Certain data tables can only be brought into certain report types, and there are line-item maximums to the number of dimensions items which can be added to groups/heirarchies.
The release program for Sage updates is also problematic. Even Sage's premier partners struggle to facilitate client release preview environment testing, and the preview environments can't be integrated with integrations, which limits the ability to test. Our company has experienced two critical integration errors over the last three updates due to the lack of this ability to test. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: Sage provides a cloud accounting platform which allows us to manage AR/AP, reporting, and financials all from one system. It also integrates with the rest of our tech stack. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column9: I like the reporting and how easily you can click into charges/ debits/ credits on the P&L. I also appreciate the audit trail that follows every transaction. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: The home services module is incredibly slow and often gives us errors. Refreshing the module takes up a lot of time and editing payments is not very easy. Additionally, there are many times where payments post to a deposit but "remain" in the module screen and I am told by support to just "delete" the payments out. The fixed asset module also could use some TLC. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: GL and financial reporting that combines both our service company and commercial department. This is entirely more effecient than having multiple sets of financial statements. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column8: "Transition from QB to Sage has had ups and downs"

column11: Having the review and sign off of journal entries and other entries prior to posting. It helps ensure that the data is accurate and that there is more than one person in the review process. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column9: I like the interactive nature of Sage Intacct. You can click through to dig into details easily, and the main ribbon at the top makes it easy to navigate through the system. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column11: Recording complex intercompany receivables with corresponding revenue accruals, as well as easily record receipt of revenue. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

Integration: Sage Intacct integrates with a range of other software, including CRM, ERP, and payroll systems. This allows for seamless data transfer and reduces the need for manual data entry.

column10: The challenge is that the cost of using Sage Intacct may be prohibitive for some organizations, particularly small businesses or nonprofits with limited budgets. Organizations should carefully consider the costs of implementing and maintaining the system before deciding to use it. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11:
Manual processes: traditional accounting involves a lot of manual processes, including data entry and reconciliations. Sage Intacct automates many of these processes, reducing the risk of errors, improving accuracy, and freeing up staff time to focus on more strategic tasks.
Lack of visibility: organizations may struggle to keep track of their financial performance in real-time, particularly if they have multiple locations or departments. Sage Intacct provides real-time visibility into financial data, including cash flow, revenue, and expenses. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column10:
Ensure that all necessary tasks are completed before entering into a contract with Sage. It is crucial to have the Sage team address your specific system requirements before committing to their services or consider exploring alternative providers.
Customization in Sage is similar to NetSuite, so be prepared to pay a premium and negotiate a favorable contract upfront if their out-of-the-box solution does not meet your needs. It can be surprising that some Sage representatives may not possess a thorough understanding of their own system and may suggest solutions that are not entirely effective. If you engage their Professional Services team, be aware that it may take a week or two to begin working with them, and the quality of their work may range from unsatisfactory to average, at a $250/hr rate.
Unlike Microsoft, where you can find a variety of skilled developers at different price points that can deliver, locating affordable Sage developers can be challenging. The high hourly rates are not the primary concern, but rather the dissatisfaction of paying for partial completion of a task. Unfortunately, the customer success team at Sage may not be very helpful, as they might lack knowledge about their own platform. Therefore, do not rely solely on their customer success team or Technology services team to deliver.
Hindsight, I would have approached this entirely different or went with an entirely different platform had we known what we know now. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column10: The reporting requirement of setting up account groups is a bit cumbersome and the inability to generate Excel reports that contain formulas in the total fields limits the effectiveness of using the reports for projections and "what if" scenarios. Budgeting is a bit cumbersome through SIBP. A big challenge I have is that when I generate general ledger detail and export it to csv or Excel, certain key data elements are not included on each line of data so the utilization of pivot tables is limited. I was hoping that using the csv export option would resolve this issue, but the format is basically the same as the Excel export and appears to be less of a data dump and more of just the same viewable data being presented in Excel. paying invoices with a Credit Card is a good feature but the way these vendor and transactions are tracked through the aging report is challenging. column8: "Great Platform for Small to Medium Businesses"
column9: There are many things I really like about Intacct. We've been using this tool for eight years, and couldn't be happier. We will start using their budget and planning tool later this year, and are very excited to introduce that to our budgeting managers. With regards to what we currently have and use, I would say that the custom reporting features are great- we've created several very useful reports. I also find that the platform is overall very user-friendly, and easy to navigate through. This is helpful when non-finance personnel are required to use Intacct. There are also many internal controls set up within the platform, which provides our auditors with assurance in our accounting software. We will also be looking into Smart Rules/Events, and potentially adding that feature on in the near future. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column11: We are using Intacct as our primary accounting software for multiple Operating Companies. One of the key benefits to using Intacct is the fact that despite having multiple Operating Companies, you are able to set them all up under a single entity, and thus, run consolidation reports and gather consolidated financial data (considering FX changes). It is also very useful to show various types of reports OpCo by OpCo, or even on a consolidated basis. Some of these reports include TTM P&Ls, Budget-to-Actual reports, Balance Sheet variance reports, etc. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column8: "Two major issues with bad customer service"
column9: Sage Intaccts arrangement and GUI are good. Sage has data templates to assist with mass data input, which are helpful. I wish there were templates for every data type, but you can make that happen by exploring their API database and inputting the fields you need into their templates. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10:
The very worst problem I had with Sage Intacct was bad customer service. They shove you off to their community site for most troubleshooting. It's an embarrassment how little they even attempt to help you with problems that surely other companies have had before. All my coworkers and I have found the customer service to be worse than Quickbooks.
The other customer service problem has to do with their inflexibility. We signed a contract and promised to have a start date in the future. Unfortunately for us and sneakily for them, they used that signed date as the software start date. So despite the fact that we did not start using the software until later, we have to pay for months of it we did not use. And because this is a repeat software subscription, we are forced to essentially pay them at negative net terms.
Upon multiple emails and meetings with them about it, they told me that's all they can do. When I said, "Can I just pay it after Net 30 of when it WOULD be due", they threatened to discontinue service. Yes, that's right. They said they would delete our organization and destroy our books for a NET TERMS DISPUTE where they are in the wrong. So be very wary when signing up for Sage. They will do very little for you, but make sure you give them what they want. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: It's accounting software. We need to book all our Assets, Liability, Equity, Income and Expenses, like any accounting software. Sage does this fine, but not terrifically. There is no module in the base package for payroll checks. (What? How?) I had to invent a way around this by booking all our payroll checks as journal entry line items. While an acceptable workaround, Sage had no idea what we needed despite explaining it to them multiple times. I had to make the software work for us, not them making it work for us. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

1) Cost effectiveness. Very expensive and time consuming to set it up, and annual fees after that keep increasing.

column11: Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payment, Bank Reconciliations, Trial Balances and General Ledgers. Invoices are received from vendors, client, lenders – this initiates the transaction. Radian enters the approved invoice into Intacct. This initiates the transaction, it is recorded in Intacct (system) AR Module. JEs are posted monthly and quarterly for items like PPD amortization, depreciation, accruals, etc. These entries are supported by schedules maintained by Radian. During the close process, these JEs are entered by the preparer and reviewed by the reviewer before they are posted to the ledger. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

Intacct is also not the best with managing cash flow so we use excel still for that. The GL pulls you can't dig into live. I would also like a feature to be added to show simplified income statements and balance sheets so that we don't have to put it into excel to calculate. The bill register and grant sections of Intacct aren't up to par. There also seems to be a fair amount of glitches and errors. I also can't seem to save my GL pulls so that next time I can pull them faster without reentering all the report details and requirements. I also don't like how it logs you out often and freezes from time to time and makes you start over with reports. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

I find myself having to keep the one with " - I" (because it contains the URL linking it to Service Titan) and then making sure the duplicate doesn't have a quantity in it before deactivating it. column8: "Sage Intacct is one of the best Accounting ERP systems in 2021"
column9: Sage Intacct has one of the best Accounting ERP systems in the industry, and here's why: you easily look up past entries and access support files very quickly. The system is intuitive and easy to use, and you don't need much training to become an expert. For example, running the GL activity is very customizable and lets you pick and choose which accounts you need to review. From there, you can quickly drill down on individual entries and much more. For posting entries, you can easily save drafts, use upload files for large entries or manually submit entries for approval. My favorite feature is the ability to duplicate past entries, and changing the date automatically changes the memo fields. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column10:
For a "modern" software, it's unbelievable that there is no equity allocations tool for partnership accounting. We have to outsource the allocations or use Excel. It's crazy. All that Intacct needs to do is setup a way for the reporting to take each partner's equity balance, divide it by the total equity, and multiply it by the net income. The report should show their total equity percentage and balances at any given point in time.
Also, The report formatting process is cumbersome and is not UI friendly. It seems to have been made for IT individuals and not accountants. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column9: We liked the ability to drill-down from a report all the way down to an invoice image. The Smart Rules and Smart Events, although not ideally implemented, are still great additions to the product. API access is available. Documentation and support for developers is very good. User documentation and Help is great. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10:
This appears to be an older product that has just been added onto over the years, and is now in need of a total re-write. As a sometime developer myself, and having looked extensively at their object modeling, I can see areas where they appear to have coded themselves into corners, and product enhancements often seem like kludgy add-ons.
Two report writers come free with the base product: The Financial Report Writer and the Custom Report Writer. These are very limited in scope and formatting. For decent reports, you will need to purchase an additional license for the Interactive Custom Report Writer, or use third-party software.
Data privacy is a big concern. With the ever increasing number of data privacy laws, best practice is to limit the user to information for which they have a business need. Intacct does not provide the kind of security permissions granularity to accomplish this. For example, if you need to give a user permission to a particular thing on one entity, they will have that permission on every company to which they have access, and there is not way to prevent it, other than purchasing multiple licenses for the same employee. In a modern ERP, administrators should be able to finely tune user permissions; the more granular control, the better. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column10: The biggest gripe I have currently is the lack of foreign currency support for credit cards. column8: "Great enterprise accounting solution, but lacking for users outside of United States."
column9: I really liked how it was able to do accounting for us on the internet, we didnt even need to use ledger books with pencils anymore. We used Intacct to enhance our accounting for foreign exchange, where the Group had a statutory obligation to report in AUD, but was operating subsidiaries in the United States, United Kingdom as well as Australia. The application that was able to enable the group to create a whole suite of reports for Group reporting for a global business was also easily achieved. Purchasing approvals are also a great function for organisations. We found revenue recognition was very helpful for long-dated sales contracts, as revenues would be automatically recorded each month. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: For me what I disliked was the cost of the product, its lack of GST support and how difficult it was to get anyone on the phone to help when something broke. In addition to that I'd like to add that the lack of native VAT/GST reporting really let this product down. Avalara is the preferred 3rd party application to handle this, but adds additional expense. Lack of general ledger detail when drilling down into consolidated reports while only a minor problem, was very annoying. Bank feeds for many banks outside of the United States also lack support. Normally this is not a problem if you can simply import the transactions using a CSV template, but the templates provided by Intacct are hard to use and are difficult to trouble-shoot when there are errors after being uploaded. The base licence cost may prove to be prohibitive for most small to medium sized organizations, as this was ultimately the reason why we decided to change accounting systems. Account management was very light-touch, with Intacct representatives preferring to refer you to their online community rather than engaging on a call, unless subscription renewal was approaching. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: We were able to solve so many problems, its really great. Intacct helped our organisation move away from manually consolidated the Group's financials each month. Removing many headaches in the process. The way foreign currency is handled is also very useful. The report writer functionality is also excellent, we were able to write customer reports which were subsequently integrated into our reporting dashboards. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column8: "Intacct is a versatile platform if you have the time and resources to configure it properly."
column9: The platform continues to become easier to use with each and every update. Key features I've enjoyed and appreciated are the following: sorting through pending tasks, establishing workflows with various stakeholders, and a very robust audit trail. Varying user access and permissions via groups is great. While I'm not responsible for creating custom variables and workflows, they appear to be flexible and have the ability to really save our staff time. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: Unable to automate certain things without some external tools, plugins, or developing web-hook tools, namely disabling a user's account when they are offboarding automatically on their last day of employment. Being unable to update a username to respect a preferred name or surname is a bit archaic and disrespectful. Establishing templates for user accounts would save a lot of time to get new users the permissions they need immediately. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: My use case in Sage Intacct does not really address or solve any problems. As an IT admin, I simply create new user accounts and disabled outgoing staff accounts within the platform, not any actual accounting. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column8: "Great Cloud-Based Accounting System for a Single Entity, Room for Improvement for a Multi-Entity"
column9: Ease of use! Within a month of using Sage Intacct I was able to learn the system without any external trainings. The reporting functionality is also very robust and simple to create custom reports without having to spend much time learning how to do so. I also like that the software is cloud based and I do not have to wait for a desktop program to start up. The software also has many partners such as FloQast, Expensify and Blissfully that allow for an easy API integration. Intacct also connects to our bank account for simplistic cash management. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: Consolidations is quite confusing! I would not recommend Intacct for a multi-entity company. It is very tough to follow a transaction through the consolidation process. Especially when dealing with international entities it can be quite difficult to follow a transaction from initial entry through intercompany through foreign exchange rate all the way to the consolidated financial statements. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: We use Sage Intacct to drive very big business decisions. We are a rapidly growing SaaS company and have used Intacct to scale with our tremendous growth and the system has been able to adapt to our business quite effortlessly. We have built over 1,000 customized reports so we can slice and dice any dimension whether it be by department, vendor, employee or project spend. Our finance team loves analyzing financial metrics that are non-GAAP and intacct provides the bandwidth to support both financial and non-financial reporting as well. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column9: I like that it's cloud based, that multiple systems integrate, and that the use is intuitive. column8: "Best in Class Accounting Software for Mid-Size Businesses Looking to Upgrade"
column9: One of the things I like best about Sage Intacct is the robust reporting capabilities and the ability to "slice and dice" data. The look and feel of Sage is generally easy to follow. column10: I think the Sage Intacct bank reconciliation and fixed asset modules could be easier to use. It would be great if the bank reconciliation served a dual purpose-bank reconciliation and general ledger entry as some other accounting software. It's a bit time consuming to enter the same banking data multiple times. The fixed asset module seems a bit clunky. It can sometimes be difficult to make updates to data (in an open period). column11: The business problems that Sage has helped us to solve are related to our accounting functionality as well as reporting and budgeting. column9: What I like best about Sage Intaact is the duplicate feature for invoices. It makes things a lot easier when you're putting in an invoice that is similar. Instead of digging around and looking for the right account to journal it to, you can pull up the previous entry and update the numbers. I also like the easy excel export. It comes in handy a lot. We use excel a lot for things such as month end reconciliation and checking different invoices when they're needed to be paid. Being able to just export it right from Sage Intaact is helpful in making that process easier. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: What I dislike about Sage is when you're searching for a vendor you have, it has to be identical to the vendor name or you won't find it. Often times I've found myself struggling to find a vendor because maybe it requires a space between two words or it uses "&" instead of "and". Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: I wouldn't say there are problems that are being solved by using Sage. column9: I like how user-friendly the whole system is. Everything is right where you would want or need it to be. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: The only thing I can think of that I don't like is regarding the hierarchy of the parent / job relationship. When you load the Jobs screen, it automatically sets up in the hierarchy. So with all the clicks, it takes a significant amount of time to turn off the hierarchy view. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column9:
-Cloud based: I can access anytime and anywhere

column9:
I really enjoy all of our entities sharing the same chart of accounts. This allows us the ability to onboard new acquisitions and produce reporting that is comparatively meaningful from day one. The third party plugins are a great way to add features to the overall package. I do wish more (or some) were included in the core product. Perhaps I am wrong but I am not sure if there are any packages that include some of the additional modules at a bundled price. That being said, the core product is great and is intuitive enough for someone with some but not prodigious technical skills to configure and customize to the needs of your organization.
You can also build it out quickly and easily to support new locations and/or entities as your company grows. By using the same chart of accounts, the set up is easy for new entities and you can start with entry and financial statements from day one that are comparative across companies. We are able to manage multiple companies in similar industries within different markets very easily but also have the reporting to compare them in a way that allows us to gain meaningful insight into why certain locations are performing better than others. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: My biggest dislike is the amount of modules that are not included in the base subscription. I could be wrong but I do not believe there is a tiered subscription model (think good, better, best) that includes more advanced modules in a subscription if you are wiling to spend the money. I am constantly doing evaluations with my account rep and an implementation specialist for a product that I then have to evaluate ROI on. I love our account rep, she is fantastic. It does feel like her job is more sales oriented than support. It sometimes feels like our monthly check ins are more designed to be a sales call which I understand but its also a little frustrating. There are not many things to dislike about Intacct. It is an investment but also one that can help you dramatically improve all cycles in your accounting department. The ability to upload and attach invoices and other documents to entries can completely digitize your AP/AR cycles which is a huge time and space saver. The audit trail becomes much clearer and easier to follow when you can go from a view of the bill entry, to the invoice and find the check # and status of the check in a few clicks. The only drawback is that it is a bit labor intensive to do that. We have augmented that process by utilizing Bill.com but it did come at an additional cost of about $30,000 annually to implement. We are very happy with the integration but wish that were able to do more with the core product in Intacct. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: We use the stock allocations to make sure that we apportion company expenses properly. We are able to produce 51 unique P&L statements and and group them by common ownership when needed to give partners easy access to progress reports. We use Bill.com as a way to automate our AP cycle and it has dramatically improved our workflow. We can process thousands of invoices every month with one clerk and able to pay everyone in a timely fashion. It allows for a great workflow and approval process. The third party apps and integrations are a great benefit. We are currently evaluating the budgeting module as a way to easily use our actual prior year performance as a way to create a realistic and fact based budget for the coming year. The automated processes we have with Bill.com and hopefully the budgeting module (we are currently evaluating) have and hopefully will represent unmatched efficiency in the AP and budgeting cycles. We are a growing organization and add new entities on a bi-annual basis for the most part. The entity set up process is simple and being able to have a suite of reporting available based on work we've done with our prior entities is a huge time saver and value. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column10: I don't like that I'm not able to put two FX rates in A/P Bills. You should be able to put one rate for the credit to A/P and then any other rate you want for the debit to expense. This means that you cannot put an average rate for a debit to expense when it's a service that is expensed at a monthly average, and then put a spot rate for the date of the invoice. The system would then automatically plug to RG(L). I also do not like that when I run a GL detail it will not give me the base currency columns. I have to manually calculate base currency balances. I need to rely on how the balances were originally imported into the system. I need to know what the original base currency balance was and keep track of that month to month, so that I can figure out what the current base currency balance is, so that I know what the monthly unrealized gain and loss is. Accpac handled this really well, so it is disappointing that a newer Sage system isn't on par with an older Sage system in every respect. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column9: The best part of Intacct for our purposes is that it is cloud based. We have employees all over the world, and we couldn't possibly use it otherwise. The interface is generally good, though it can be confusing (the old UI was easier to use and teach others). It is nice that we can attach instruction documents in specific modules though. The ability to link bank accounts to automatically import bank transactions sounds great, though we haven't been able to set it up yet. Also, the level of possible customization is helpful, but can also be dangerous. Overall, it does what we need it to do. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10:
The change to the newer Action UI removed the ability to open or approve purchasing requests or Time & Expense reports from the dashboard, which made the dashboard much less useful. And each update seems to cause bugs that break something else, particularly our customizations. The most recent was the ability to delete attached files in an existing folder. These are generally fixable, but it is a pain to correct bugs after every update.
Also, Manage Views does not show every field, which would be very helpful. For instance, we added a "permanently declined" checkbox to help avoid declined requests from being resubmitted (though it's still possible, so this is just a deterrent), but this field can't be added to the approval views to allow us to easily spot these requests and avoid approving them should they be resubmitted. In addition, the Favorites menu, while a good idea, doesn't show where an option is, so there are issues like an option just saying "approve transactions" with no identifier of what kind of transactions. The one for T&E says "approve expenses", which is much more helpful.
The new bank reconciliations module is also much more difficult to use than the old one if you need to upload transactions. The import process is confusing, and If you have to save and later reopen a reconciliation, you lose the bank tab so you can no longer see and match the transactions. The bank data is still there though, as if you upload again, you have duplicate transactions. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11: We are able to coordinate employees all over the world, and only those with the poorest of internet connections have issues using it. The benefits I covered in the first question. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column10: I had to figure out how to get around an attachment issue and it was quite the problem: If I attached my card statement to more than one submission (because they had different approval paths), the additional attachments with that statement would overwrite the other attachments in the other submissions. column9:
The interface is easy to understand and use

column10:

The model we use isn't optimized for Intacct which creates friction in processes and procedures.
Setting up reports and a reporting infrastructure can be a little clunky at first but once you have the knowledge and done it once or twice you will find ways to optimize.

column9: I like the ease of use of the various modules and how they intertwine with the GL, such as the AR and AP module as well as the cash management functionality. Revaluating FX is also a breeze using Intacct. Our company uses Intacct to integrate to various other software such as MineralTree and Floqast, and these make month-end and AP automation much quicker and easier. Our company also uses Intacct for consolidation and financial reporting. Intacct is able to run detailed reports on the entity level as well as on a consolidated level which are easy to manipulate for our financial reporting. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10: Nuances such as clearing AR or AP sometimes get complicated. When there are multiple different currencies (more than 2) in the same transaction, Intacct has a hard time processing these and we have had to find workarounds by booking to different accounts before clearing the bank or control accounts. There are often legacy issues such as when AR or AP were entered incorrectly (via journal entry instead of using the invoice function in the modules) and then they are hard to get rid of after-the-fact. With multiple currencies, there isn't an easy way to clear old balances related to fx and the revaluation function will always take those small old balances into consideration. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column9:
Sage Intacct is easy to use, extremely customizable, and can handle a large amount of data. Integrations with other systems like Expensify, Nexonia, and Sugar CRM is easy to implement and manage. Internal module add-ons like Prepaid Module and Fixed Assets Module makes accounting easier to track and manage.
Custom fields, rules, and reports are by far the best thing about Sage Intacct. Other accounting software limits options but Intacct will allow almost any customization you can think of. Being able to add multiple custom fields to transactions help us track and report more easily. For example, if we have a chargeback, we can copy the original transaction including all of its details to the chargeback transaction. We can then run reports to see the Customer's full picture of invoices, payment, chargebacks, etc. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column10:
We currently sync expense reports to AP Bills as opposed to Credit Cards in Cash Management. The reason for this is due to the Credit Cards requiring a General Ledger account for each to post to. When employees switched cards, we would have to set up a new GL account for each new card which was far too cumbersome. Since switching to the AP Bills module, this has alleviated the issue.
Another short-coming of Intacct is not being able to report cross-module. For example, the subledgers post in batches to the ledgers, so to see details you must report from the subledgers directly, however if an entry like expense reports posts directly to AP ledger, it wouldn't be in the subledger report. Not being able to combing Purchasing and AP in reports poses an issue when trying to see detail and the full picture. We tried an external reporting program to help mitigate this but the project was far too data sensitive and still didn't get us what we needed. We're able to use the custom reports in Intacct and we find work-arounds. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
column11:
Prior to Sage Intacct, our company struggled with reporting of items per type and location. Intacct's customization allows us to group items by type and location which shows up cleanly on reports.
Expense reports were handled with manual entries which was time consuming, but after implementing Expensify, the two systems sync transactions seamlessly, reducing our monthly effort by at least 50%.
The global search function is also very handy when trying to track down certain transactions that may be in several modules. Instead of searching each individually, you're able to do a global search for an amount which will bring up all posted entries in all modules.
Dashboards have helped save time and manual running of reports for our decision makers in the company. They're able to see real-time sales and monitor marking efforts.
Memorized and scheduled reporting also saves a huge amount of time each month. We no longer have to run reports, the system automatically emails reports to users who need it. We try to automate as much as possible using Intacct and the reporting is by far the most valuable automation for us. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

column9: I appreciate the design of Sage Intacct aesthetically. It's a pleasant application to use in it's design. The wide array of information and functions available is also a huge plus! Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
